title: Spreading rock dust on farms is an overlooked but tantalizing climate solution
description: The simple act of sprinkling rock dust—an abundant byproduct of mining—on farmland could capture 45% percent of the carbon dioxide required to help the UK meet its 2050 net-zero targets.This new figure from a recent study adds to a growing body of evidence looking at the power of minerals to draw down carbon, while also replenishing agricultural soils. In fact, rocks are some of our planet’s greatest carbon sinks.
